p: Cyclopropavir (MBX-400) is another extensively investigated compound. It is a methylenecyclopropane nucleoside analogue structurally related to drugs such as acyclovir, ganciclovir and penciclovir. In vitro studies demonstrated its activity against such herpesviruses as CMV, HHV-6 and HHV-8 ( Price and Prichard, 2011). Cyclopropavir was in phase 1 clinical trials to assess its safety and pharmacokinetics (NCT01433835) and (NCT02454699).
